page.title: 06Fyfield Local History
page.content: The area has changed little because in 1555 Sir Thomas White, who lived in the manor, as the founder of St. John's College Oxford, left his whole estate to them. They have only recently allowed a few properties to be sold, because of the recent legislation on security of tenure. On one side of Fyfield Manor is Manor Farm house, from where the third generation of the Lay family is farming the area. It was built in 1665 as a place of refuge for fellows during the plague. On the other side is St. Nicholas Church dating from pre 1086. The woodwork was replaced after a bad fire in 1893. There is a unique memento mori in the Golafre Chapel (1442). Beyond the organ is the tomb (1537) of Lady Catherine Gordon, wife of Perkin Warbeck.
